intro: Boehmeria candicans, commonly known as the Chinese nettle or Indian nettle, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Urticaceae family, which includes many species of stinging plants. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Boehmeria candicans is also valued for its fibers, which have been used in traditional textiles and papermaking.
